meta.name: twitter:description
meta.content: A morphing animation to represent different devices. If you like this you can buy it [here](https://gannon.tv/products/morphing-devices)...
A morphing animation to represent different devices. If you like this you can buy it [here](https://gannon.tv/products/morphing-devices)...

meta.name: description
meta.content: A morphing animation to represent different devices. If you like this you can buy it [here](https://gannon.tv/products/morphing-devices)...

meta.name: apple-mobile-web-app-capable
meta.script: /* Firefox needs this to prevent FOUC. */

body.class: room-editor editor state-htmlOn-cssOn-jsOn sidebar-false layout-top logged-out

div.div: A Pen By Chris Gannon PRO

div.p: HTML preprocessors can make writing HTML more powerful or convenient. For instance, Markdown is designed to be easier to write and read for text documents and you could write a loop in Pug.
Learn more · Versions

In CodePen, whatever you write in the HTML editor is what goes within the <body> tags in a basic HTML5 template. So you don't have access to higher-up elements like the <html> tag. If you want to add classes there that can affect the whole document, this is the place to do it.
In CodePen, whatever you write in the HTML editor is what goes within the <body> tags in a basic HTML5 template. If you need things in the <head> of the document, put that code here.
The resource you are linking to is using the 'http' protocol, which may not work when the browser is using https.

form.button: ↑ Insert the most common viewport meta tag

form.class: settings-row settings-row-1 top-label-form normal-labels preprocessor-choice group

div.p: CSS preprocessors help make authoring CSS easier. All of them offer things like variables and mixins to provide convenient abstractions.
Learn more · Versions

It's a common practice to apply CSS to a page that styles elements such that they are consistent across all browsers. We offer two of the most popular choices: normalize.css and a reset. Or, choose Neither and nothing will be applied.
To get the best cross-browser support, it is a common practice to apply vendor prefixes to CSS properties and values that require them to work. For instance -webkit- or -moz-.
We offer two popular choices: Autoprefixer (which processes your CSS server-side) and -prefix-free (which applies prefixes via a script, client-side).

form.p: Any URL's added here will be added as <link>s in order, and before the CSS in the editor. If you link to another Pen, it will include the CSS from that Pen. If the preprocessor matches, it will attempt to combine them before processing.

span.style: position: relative; display: inline-block; direction: ltr;

pre.style: position: absolute; visibility: hidden; white-space: pre; font-family: Lato, "Lucida Grande", "Lucida Sans Unicode", Tahoma, sans-serif; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; word-spacing: 0px; letter-spacing: 0px; text-indent: 0px; text-rendering: auto; text-transform: none;

span.style: position: absolute; top: 100%; left: 0px; z-index: 100; display: none; right: auto;

div.p: You can apply CSS to your Pen from any stylesheet on the web. Just put a URL to it here and we'll apply it, in the order you have them, before the CSS in the Pen itself.
If the stylesheet you link to has the file extension of a preprocessor, we'll attempt to process it before applying.

You can also link to another Pen here, and we'll pull the CSS from that Pen and include it. If it's using a matching preprocessor, we'll combine the code before preprocessing, so you can use the linked Pen as a true dependency.
The resource you are linking to is using the HTTP protocol, which may not work when the browser is using HTTPS.
The resource you are linking to is using the HTTP protocol, which may not work when the browser is using HTTPS.

form.script:
<div data-view-id="<%= view_id %>" class="external-resource-url-row <%= insecure_resource %>">
<input id="external-resource-input-<%= view_id %>" class="fullwidth css-resource external-resource" type="text" pattern="^((ftp|http|https):)?\/\/(\w+:{0,1}\w*@)?(\S+)(:[0-9]+)?(\/|\/([\w#!:.?+=&%@!\-\/]))?$" name="external-css" placeholder="<%= placeholder %>" value="<%= url %>" data-view-id="<%= view_id %>">
!
Insecure Resource
The resource you are linking to is using the HTTP protocol, which may not work when the browser is using HTTPS.
<span class="remove-external-url external-url-option" data-view-id="<%= view_id %>">
<a id="external-resource-input-view-link-<%= view_id %>" class="open-external-url external-url-option" target="_blank" rel="noopener" data-view-id="<%= view_id %>" href="<%= url %>">

div.p: JavaScript preprocessors can help make authoring JavaScript easier and more convenient. For instance, CoffeeScript can help prevent easy-to-make mistakes and offer a cleaner syntax and Babel can bring ECMAScript 6 features to browsers that only support ECMAScript 5.
Learn more · Versions

div.div: Babel is required to process package imports. If you need a different preprocessor remove all packages first.

div.p: Any URL's added here will be added as <script>s in order, and run before the JavaScript in the editor. You can use the URL of any other Pen and it will include the JavaScript from that Pen.

span.style: position: relative; display: inline-block; direction: ltr;

input.placeholder: Search CDNjs (jQuery, Lodash, React, Angular, Vue.js, Ember...)

pre.style: position: absolute; visibility: hidden; white-space: pre; font-family: Lato, "Lucida Grande", "Lucida Sans Unicode", Tahoma, sans-serif; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; word-spacing: 0px; letter-spacing: 0px; text-indent: 0px; text-rendering: auto; text-transform: none;

span.style: position: absolute; top: 100%; left: 0px; z-index: 100; display: none; right: auto;

div.p: You can apply a script from anywhere on the web to your Pen. Just put a URL to it here and we'll add it, in the order you have them, before the JavaScript in the Pen itself.
If the script you link to has the file extension of a preprocessor, we'll attempt to process it before applying.

You can also link to another Pen here, and we'll pull the JavaScript from that Pen and include it. If it's using a matching preprocessor, we'll combine the code before preprocessing, so you can use the linked Pen as a true dependency.
The resource you are linking to is using the HTTP protocol, which may not work when the browser is using HTTPS.
The resource you are linking to is using the HTTP protocol, which may not work when the browser is using HTTPS.

div.script:
<div data-view-id="<%= view_id %>" class="external-resource-url-row <%= insecure_resource %>">
<input id="external-resource-input-<%= view_id %>" class="fullwidth js-resource external-resource" type="text" pattern="^((ftp|http|https):)?\/\/(\w+:{0,1}\w*@)?(\S+)(:[0-9]+)?(\/|\/([\w#!:.?+=&%@!\-\/]))?$" name="external-js" placeholder="<%= placeholder %>" value="<%= url %>" data-view-id="<%= view_id %>">
!
Insecure Resource
The resource you are linking to is using the HTTP protocol, which may not work when the browser is using HTTPS.
<span class="remove-external-url external-url-option" data-view-id="<%= view_id %>">
<a id="external-resource-input-view-link-<%= view_id %>" class="open-external-url external-url-option" target="_blank" rel="noopener" data-view-id="<%= view_id %>" href="<%= url %>">

div.p: We can make npm packages available for you to use in your JavaScript. We use webpack to prepare them and make them available to import or require. We'll also process your JavaScript with Babel.
⚠️ This feature can only be used by logged in users.
If active, Pens will autosave every 30 seconds after being saved once.

form.p: If enabled, the preview panel updates automatically as you code. If disabled, use the "Run" button to update.

div.h4: Want to change your Syntax Highlighting theme, Fonts and more?
div.p: Visit your global Editor Settings.
HTML Settings

Here you can Sed posuere consectetur est at lobortis. Donec ullamcorper nulla non metus auctor fringilla. Maecenas sed diam eget risus varius blandit sit amet non magna. Donec id elit non mi porta gravida at eget metus. Praesent commodo cursus magna, vel scelerisque nisl consectetur et.

div.style: overflow: hidden; position: relative; width: 3px; height: 0px; top: 4px; left: 43px;

textarea.style: position: absolute; bottom: -1em; padding: 0px; width: 1000px; height: 1em; outline: none;

div.style: margin-left: 39px; margin-bottom: -17px; border-right-width: 13px; min-height: 50px; padding-right: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px;
position: absolute; height: 13px; width: 1px; border-bottom: 0px solid transparent; top: 50px;
overflow: hidden; position: relative; width: 3px; height: 0px; top: 4px; left: 43px;

textarea.style: position: absolute; bottom: -1em; padding: 0px; width: 1000px; height: 1em; outline: none;

div.style: margin-left: 39px; margin-bottom: -16px; border-right-width: 14px; min-height: 696px; padding-right: 9px; padding-bottom: 0px;
position: absolute; height: 14px; width: 1px; border-bottom: 0px solid transparent; top: 696px;
overflow: hidden; position: relative; width: 3px; height: 0px; top: 4px; left: 43px;

textarea.style: position: absolute; bottom: -1em; padding: 0px; width: 1000px; height: 1em; outline: none;

div.style: margin-left: 39px; margin-bottom: -17px; border-right-width: 13px; min-height: 1445px; padding-right: 9px; padding-bottom: 0px;
position: absolute; height: 13px; width: 1px; border-bottom: 0px solid transparent; top: 1445px;

iframe.name: CodePen
iframe.sandbox: allow-forms allow-modals allow-pointer-lock allow-popups allow-presentation allow-same-origin allow-scripts
iframe.allow: geolocation; microphone; camera; midi; vr; accelerometer; gyroscope; payment; ambient-light-sensor; encrypted-media

div.title: Drag to resize. Double-click to expand.
Drag to resize. Double-click to expand.

section.div: Shift F Opt F Find & Replace

div.div: CodePen requires JavaScript to render the code and preview areas in this view.
div.p: Trying viewing this Pen in Debug Mode, which is the preview area without any iframe and does not require JavaScript. Although what the preview is of might!
Need to know how to enable JavaScript? Go here.
div.label: Close this, use anyway.

For instance, Markdown is designed to be easier to write and read for text documents and you could write a loop in Pug."},"visible":true,"values":[{"id":"none","name":"None","value":"none","default":true},{"id":"haml","name":"Haml","value":"haml"},{"id":"markdown","name":"Markdown","value":"markdown"},{"id":"slim","name":"Slim","value":"slim"},{"id":"pug","name":"Pug","value":"pug"}]},{"id":"html_classes","name":"Add Class(es) to <html>","type":"input","placeholder":"e.g. single post post-1234","help":{"title":"Adding Classes","text":"In CodePen, whatever you write in the HTML editor is what goes within the <body> tags in a basic HTML5 template. So you don't have access to higher-up elements like the <html> tag. If you want to add classes there that can affect the whole document, this is the place to do it."},"visible":true},{"id":"head","name":"Stuff for <head>","type":"textarea","placeholder":"e.g. <meta>, <link>, <script>","help":{"title":"About the <Head>","text":"In CodePen, whatever you write in the HTML editor is what goes within the <body> tags in a basic HTML5 template. If you need things in the <head> of the document, put that code here."},"visible":true}],"actions":[{"id":"tidy_html","name":"Tidy HTML"},{"id":"analyze_html","name":"Analyze HTML"},{"id":"maximize_html_editor","name":"Maximize HTML Editor"},{"id":"minimize_html_editor","name":"Minimize HTML Editor"},{"id":"fold_all","name":"Fold All"},{"id":"unfold_all","name":"Unfold
